intro: Microlonchus duriaei var. tenella, commonly known as the slender sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a stem that is typically less than 30 centimeters in height. It plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
